creator: anca.soncutean@softvision.ro
summary: [Performance] Save buttons are overlapped by the scrollbar

assigned_to_detail.name: nobody@mozilla.org
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

comments.text:
Created attachment 8983028
screeshot issue.png

[Affected versions]: 
- 60.0.1 (20180516032328)
- 61.0b10 (20180530184300)
- 62.0a1 (2018-06-03)

[Affected platforms]:
- Windows 10 x64
- Ubuntu 16.04 x64
- macOS 10.13

[Steps to reproduce]: 
1. Launch Firefox
2. Open the Performance page (Shift + F5)
3. Perform several recordings until the scrollbar is displayed (by clicking on the Toggle the recording state of a performance recording button).
4. Observe the Recordings pane

[Expected result]:
- The Save buttons are completely visible.

[Actual result]:
- The scrollbar overlaps the Save buttons.

[Regression range]:
- This is an old regression, therefore I was able to restrain the regression range, only to the following:
  Last good revision: 66a77b9bfe5dcacd50eccf85de7c0e7e15ce0ffd (2016-09-28)
  First bad revision: f7d5008ee2ab9200052e45ad6ecc3f3a348f7f86 (2016-09-29)
  Pushlog: https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/pushloghtml?fromchange=66a77b9bfe5dcacd50eccf85de7c0e7e15ce0ffd&tochange=f7d5008ee2ab9200052e45ad6ecc3f3a348f7f86 

[Additional Notes]:
- The functionality of the buttons are not affected by this issue.
- Resizing the browser (including fullscreen) has no influence on this behavior.
comments.author: anca.soncutean@softvision.ro

comments.text: From that range, I'm going to guess bug 1302062.
comments.author: ryanvm@gmail.com

comments.text:
Seems like bug 1425809.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 1425809 ***
comments.author: past@mozilla.com
